Podcasts


Updated 15 July 2019

Design & Development

  • Creative Pep Talk – Andy J Miller is an extremely encouraging host.
  • Shop Talk – Chris Coyier and Dave Rupert host a show on front-end web development. Recorded live on most Thursdays.
  • Australian Design Radio – Try Episode 02, 32, 33
  • Ask A Freelancer – A short-format podcast where Andy [J Miller] answers three submitted questions.

Comedy

  • Spontaneanation – Improv show hosted by Paul F Tompkins. Try Episodes 137, 156, 159
  • Comedy Bang! Bang! – Scott Aukerman interviews comedians and other strange characters.
  • Threedom – Paul F Tompkins, Lauren Lapkus, and Scott Aukerman hang out.
  • The Big Ones – Amanda Lund and Maria Blasucci – the best co-hosting duo in podcasts – tackle the big questions of life.
  • Superego – Improvised sketches by Drs Matt Gourley, Jeremy Carter, and Paul F Tompkins.
  • Your Kickstarter Sucks – Bad Kickstarter projects are pretty funny, but the hosts are even funnier.

Stories

  • Reply All – Stories about the internet, hosted by PJ Vogt and Alex Goldman. “It features stories about how people shape the internet, and the internet shapes people.” Try Episode 56.
  • Imaginary Worlds
  • Mystery Show
  • Heavyweight
  • Revisionist History

Canada

  • CBC News: World Report – Daily 10-min news show from the CBC.
  • Canadaland
  • Front Burner – Kind of like The Daily, but for Canada. A deep dive on a current news story from the CBC.
  • Commons – The political side of *Canadaland*.
  • The Imposter – Canadian art show from *Canadaland*.

Information

  • Function
  • Today Explained
  • Invisibilia

Etc

  • James Bonding – Matt Mira and Matt Gourley revisit every James Bond film with their comedy friends.
  • Code Switch – “A team of journalists fascinated by the overlapping themes of race, ethnicity and culture, how they play out in our lives and communities, and how all of this is shifting.”
  • Star Wars Minute – Two guys take on the almost impossible task of analyzing one single minute of the Star Wars series per podcast episode.
  • Good Christian Fun – and Caroline poke fun at Christian pop culture.
  • Song Exploder – Musicians take apart their songs, and piece by piece, tell the story of how they were made.
  • The Sporkful – The Sporkful isn’t for foodies, it’s for eaters.
  • Dissect – Dissect is a serialized music podcast. Season 1 looks at Kendrick Lamar’s To Pimp a Butterfly.
  • Switched On Pop – A songwriter and a musicologist break down how popular music works.
  • Sunday Night in Canada
  • Whatevertown – Okay, this one is mine.
